text.div:
AbnormalityDensityVS ValueSet

Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) is the presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct in the breast. DCIS is considered the earliest form of breast cancer. DCIS is noninvasive, meaning it hasn't spread out of the milk duct and has a low risk of becoming invasive.

name: AbnormalityDensityVS
title: AbnormalityDensityVS
description:
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) is the presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct in the breast.
DCIS is considered the earliest form of breast cancer. DCIS is noninvasive, meaning it hasn't spread out of the milk duct and has a low risk of becoming invasive.

concept.display: These are rounded calcifications with a lucent center usually representing dermal calcifications. Larger calcifications with lucent centers may be due to oil cysts/fat necrosis and may follow surgery or trauma.
X-ray attenuation of the mass is the same as the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
Includes all masses containing fat, such as oil cyst, lipoma, or galactocele as well as mixeddensity lesions such as hamartoma.
X-ray attenuation of the mass is grater than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
X-ray attenuation of the mass is less than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
